title: Cameron Says UK Ready to Strike Houthis If Attacks Continue
description: The UK is ready to carry out further strikes on Houthi targets if the group continues to attack vessels in the Red Sea, Foreign Secretary David Cameron said in an article for the Telegraph newspaper.

title: Kerry to Step Down as Biden Administration’s Climate Envoy
description: John Kerry, the top US climate diplomat, intends to step down after more than three years relentlessly pressing countries to get more aggressive in the fight against global warming, according to people with knowledge of the matter.

title: Pakistani Top Court Blocks Imran Khan Party from Contesting Vote
description: Pakistan’s Supreme Court barred former Prime Minister Imran Khan’s party from contesting elections by denying it a cricket-bat symbol at the polls, a major setback to the country’s most popular politician weeks before the national vote.

title: Extreme Cold Hammers Wide Swath of US Over Holiday Weekend
description: Extreme winter cold is numbing a wide swath of the US, bringing sleet, snow and freezing rain as far south as Texas, testing its power grid, and even forcing temperature-hearty Buffalo to postpone Sunday’s NFL game.

title: Austin Still Hospitalized With No Return Date Set, Pentagon Says
description: Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin remains hospitalized in good condition with no date set for his release, a Pentagon spokesman said Saturday.

title: Two Navy SEALs Are Missing After Night Mission Off Somalia Coast
description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Two U.S. Navy SEALs are missing after conducting a nighttime boarding mission Thursday off the coast of Somalia, according to three U.S. officials.

title: A Major Republican Donor in Iowa Says He's Decided to Back Trump
description: Bruce Rastetter, a major Iowa Republican donor, predicted a resounding Iowa caucus victory for Donald Trump, saying the agriculturally-heavy state maintains nostalgia for the former president’s tenure in the White House.

title: Colombia Landslide Kills 33, Mostly Children, Official Says
description: A landslide in northwestern Colombia has now killed at least 33 people, most of them children, the country’s Vice President Francia Márquez Mina said on Saturday.

title: NFL’s Bills-Steelers Game Postponed Until Monday for Weather
description: A game planned for Sunday afternoon between the NFL’s Buffalo Bills and Pittsburgh Steelers was postponed until Monday because of a winter storm, New York Governor Kathy Hochul said on X.

title: Biden Says US Doesn’t Support Taiwan Independence After Vote
description: President Joe Biden said the US did not support independence for Taiwan, after voters there defied China and returned the governing Democratic Progressive Party — which has sought to limit Beijing’s influence — to a third consecutive term.

title: UN Peacekeepers to Leave Congo by End of 2024 After 25 Years
description: The United Nations will withdraw its peacekeeping force from the Democratic Republic of Congo by the end of 2024 despite ongoing fighting that’s displaced a record number of people.

title: Bill Ackman Is Bringing Activist Playbook to America’s Culture Wars
description: Bill Ackman wants you to know this: He’s just getting started, and he doesn’t care that he’s making adversaries in the media or on the political left.

title: Taiwan’s Next President Is Former Kidney Doctor Beijing Despises
description: Lai Ching-te has spent the past year convincing voters he can keep the peace, despite being despised by Beijing. His ability to deter conflict will be tested now his Democratic Progressive Party has won a record third straight presidential victory.

title: Biden Refines Economic Pitch for 2024 in Bet Worst Is Behind Him
description: President Joe Biden is adopting an election-year message that zeros in on addressing voter concerns about affordability and high prices in a bid to boost his economic case to voters.

title: Ecuador’s President Leverages Narco War to Push Overdue Reforms
description: As Ecuador fights to contain violent gangs, President Daniel Noboa is making a patriotic appeal to citizens to bear part of the cost.

title: Communities Agree to End Roadblocks at Chile Lithium Operations
description: Indigenous communities in northern Chile agreed to lift roadblocks that have restricted access to the country’s giant lithium operations since Jan. 9.

title: Airstrikes, the Economy and Friends: Your Saturday UK Briefing
description: Hello from London, where even the rubbish can be worth £22,000 (as long as it’s a    Friends script).

title: Taiwan Set to Elect President Despised by China in a Setback for Xi
description: Taiwan looks set to elect Lai Ching-te as its next leader after the main opposition candidate conceded, lining up a man Beijing has labeled an “instigator of war” for the presidency.

title: Russia Fires Missile Barrage at Ukraine as Temperatures Plunge
description: Ukraine suffered its third large-scale aerial barrage of the new year, with the escalation of attacks from Kremlin forces coming at a time harsh weather leaves millions vulnerable to power outages.

title: Turkey Launches Airstrikes Against Kurdish Militants in Iraq and Syria
description: ISTANBUL (AP) — Turkey carried out airstrikes targeting Kurdish militants in neighboring Iraq and Syria on Saturday, the Turkish Defense Ministry said. This comes a day after an attack on a Turkish military base in Iraq killed nine Turkish soldiers.

title: Communist China Clamps Down on Chatter About Taiwan’s Election
description: China’s ruling Communist Party is reining in internet discussion about Taiwan’s election, a sign of the autocratic government’s displeasure with the democratic exercise.

title: Sunak’s Allies Urge Him to Focus on Starmer, Not Farage Ahead of UK General Election
description: Rishi Sunak’s advisers are pushing the prime minister to fight the looming general election with Keir Starmer’s Labour Party on the economy rather than risk boosting Nigel Farage’s Reform UK by talking too loudly about migration.

title: Comoros Leader Seeks New Term Amid Calls for Election Boycott
description: Comoros President Azali Assoumani is seeking another five years as the head of the Indian Ocean nation in elections scheduled for Sunday.

title: It Took a TV Show to Bring Justice in UK’s Post Office Scandal
description: Seema Misra was pregnant when she was wrongfully found guilty of stealing from the Post Office she ran in a small town south-west of London. Seven months later, including four spent in jail, she gave birth in the hospital wearing an ankle tag used to monitor released criminals.

title: Taiwan Votes to Pick a President in a Test of Ties With the US and China
description: A voter casts a ballot at a polling station in Banqiao, New Taipei, Taiwan, on Saturday, Jan. 13, 2024. Taiwanese voters are heading to the polls in an election that will determine their island’s relationship with Washington and Beijing for years to come, and impact regional security.

title: Senegal Presidential Hopeful Ousmane Sonko Barred from 2024 Vote
description: Senegal’s main opposition politician Ousmane Sonko was eliminated from next month’s presidential election, according to a preliminary list of candidates published by the Constitutional Council on Friday, newspaper Le Soleil reported.

title: US Launches Fresh Yemen Strike a Day After Broader Attack
description: The US launched a fresh airstrike on a Houthi rebel radar instillation Friday, in what was described as a follow-up attack to an earlier barrage across Yemen intended to degrade the group’s ability to target commercial shipping in the Red Sea.

title: Trans Mountain Pipeline Change Approved, Averting Years of Delay
description: Trans Mountain Corp.’s application to use smaller pipes in a section of its pipeline expansion project was approved by Canada’s energy regulator, averting potentially “years” of delays in finishing a project that was scheduled to start this quarter.

title: Jeffrey Epstein Files Disclosed a Little Too Much, Judge Says
description: Some of the hundreds of documents tied to Jeffrey Epstein that were released earlier this month weren’t properly redacted, resulting in some of the people named “fearing for their safety,” a federal judge said Friday.

title: Taiwan 2024 Election Results
description: See live results of Taiwan’s election, as Lai Ching-te, Hou Yu-ih and Ko Wen-je compete for the presidency.
